    #Algebraic Geometry
    2011

    (ii) Show that n×nn \times nn×n matrices with distinct eigenvalues form an affine variety, and are a Zariski open subvariety of affine space An2\mathbb{A}^{n^{2}}An2 over an algebraically closed field.

    (iii) Let char⁡A(x)=det⁡(xI−A)\operatorname{char}_{A}(x)=\operatorname{det}(x I-A)charA​(x)=det(xI−A) be the characteristic polynomial of AAA. Show that the n×nn \times nn×n matrices AAA such that char⁡A(A)=0\operatorname{char}_{A}(A)=0charA​(A)=0 form a Zariski closed subvariety of An2\mathbb{A}^{n^{2}}An2. Hence conclude that this subvariety is all of An2\mathbb{A}^{n^{2}}An2.

    (iii) Π1(X×Y,(x,y))\Pi_{1}(X \times Y,(x, y))Π1​(X×Y,(x,y)) is isomorphic to Π1(X,x)×Π1(Y,y)\Pi_{1}(X, x) \times \Pi_{1}(Y, y)Π1​(X,x)×Π1​(Y,y) for any two spaces XXX and YYY.

    (i) Explain briefly what is meant by saying that a continuous-time Markov chain X(t)X(t)X(t) is a birth-and-death process with birth rates λi>0,i⩾0\lambda_{i}>0, i \geqslant 0λi​>0,i⩾0, and death rates μi>0\mu_{i}>0μi​>0, i⩾1i \geqslant 1i⩾1.
